title: Royal Indian Navy Mutiny
summary: Indian sailors revolt against the British Royal Navy, accelerating independence.

title: Cabinet Mission to India
summary: British Cabinet Mission arrives to discuss the transfer of power to Indian leadership.

title: Constituent Assembly — First Session
summary: The Constituent Assembly of India convenes for the first time to draft the Constitution.

title: 🇮🇳 Indian Independence
summary: India gains independence from British colonial rule after nearly 200 years.
description: At the stroke of midnight on August 15, 1947, India became an independent nation. Jawaharlal Nehru delivered his famous "Tryst with Destiny" speech to the Constituent Assembly, marking a new chapter in the history of the subcontinent.

title: Assassination of Mahatma Gandhi
summary: Mahatma Gandhi is assassinated by Nathuram Godse in New Delhi.
description: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, the leader of India's non-violent independence movement, was shot dead at point-blank range during a prayer meeting at Birla House. His last words were reported to be "He Ram" (Oh God).

title: Republic Day — Constitution Enacted
summary: India's Constitution comes into effect, declaring India a sovereign democratic republic.
description: The Constitution of India, drafted by a committee chaired by Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, came into effect on January 26, 1950—a date chosen to honour the 1930 Purna Swaraj (complete independence) declaration.
